name: db_mysql

db_mysql/log_bin.description: Defines the filename and location of your MySQL stored binlog files.  This sets the log-bin variable in the MySQL config file.  If you do not specify an absolute path, it will be relative to the data directory. Ex: /mnt/mysql-binlogs/mysql-bin

db_mysql/server_usage.description: Use 'dedicated' if the mysql config file allocates all existing resources of the machine.  Use 'shared' if the MySQL config file is configured to use less resources so that it can be run concurrently with other apps like Apache and Rails for example.

long_description:
= RightScale Database Manager for MySQL  

== DESCRIPTION:

Provides the MySQL implementation of the 'db' resource to install and 
manage MySQL database stand-alone servers and clients.


== DETAILS

The 'db' implementation is defined by a Lightweight Provider, which can be 
found in the providers/default.rb file.

The majority of the functionality of the MySQL provider is encapsulated 
in the premium rightscale_tools gem, however, there are currently a handful
of recipes that can be used without it. See 'Public Recipes' in the USAGE
section below.


== REQUIREMENTS:

* Requires a VM launched from a RightScale managed RightImage 

* Tested on CentOS 5.6 RightImage

* Supports MySQL 5.1 

* Needs RightScale Premium ServerTemplate tools gem installed on system.
  This gem is only available for paid RightScale customers.
  Please contact sales@rightscale.com to upgrade you account.


== SETUP:

* Place db::default recipe into your runlist to setup the db resource.  When
  using a RightScale ServerTemplate, this will also automatically add the 
  common database attributes to your ServerTemplate inputs.
   
* Also, place the db_mysql::default recipe into your runlist to load the
  MySQL provider, tuning parameters, as well as other MySQL specific 
  attributes in as inputs.

== USAGE:

=== Basic usage
Once setup, use the recipes in the 'db' cookbook to install and manage your
MySQL database servers and clients.  See the db/README.rdoc for usage 
details.


=== MySQL Tuning and my.cnf

Custom tuning parameters can be applied by overriding the mysql_tuning.rb
attributes file.  For more information and an example override repository
please see:

  https://github.com/ekargard/cookbooks_override/tree/master/cookbooks/db_mysql
  

=== Public Recipes
Here is the list of db recipes that can be used without the preimum 
rightscale_tools gem:

* db::default
* db::install_client
* db::install_server
* db::setup_monitoring
* db::setup_privileges_admin
* db::setup_privileges_application
* db::do_appserver_allow
* db::do_appserver_deny
* db::request_appserver_allow
* db::request_appserver_deny

These recipes are used by the RightScale LAMP ServerTemplate.


== KNOWN LIMITATIONS

* none

recipes.db_mysql::default_5_1: Set DB MySQL provider, set version 5.1 and node variables specific to MySQL 5.1
recipes.db_mysql::default_5_5: Set DB MySQL provider, set version 5.5 and node variables specific to MySQL 5.5
recipes.db_mysql::default_server: Set DB MySQL server specfic input variables
